review_title: "Empowering Lives and Guiding Choices: Medicare Counselors Make a Difference!"
job_title: Medicare Assistance Counselor in Reno, NV
pros: An Outstanding Benefits Package: Our Employer's Commitment to Employee Well-being Sets the Bar High, Providing Comprehensive Support and Genuine Appreciation! Just got a cost of living increase and I have only been with the company for 9 months. The supervisors have an open-door policy and are very employee oriented.
cons: I encourage you to continue with the great work that Access to Healthcare is currently doing.

cons: None and when there has been any, it is resolved promptly!

job_title: Non-Medical Case Manager in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Very laid back and lots of PTO

review_title: Nepotism and favortism at it's worse!
pros: Decent time off and sick pay.  If you keep your head down and mouth shut the job can be fine but don't try to speak up unless you are on the CEO's favorites list.  Starting pay is great but it never goes anywhere.
cons: If you lucky enough to move up from entry level staff to supervising or managing your salary will Not increase in line with the demands of work and responsibility.  Any cost of living raises will be lost if promoted and given a salary increase,  Salaries for management are way below the level of expected expertise.  Health Insurance benefits go up every year and never change due to personal relationships with ownership.  Reviews are never done unless management needs to document poor performance in preparation of letting someone go.

pros: Opportunity for growth,  supportive of family, work/life balance, coworkers are great, open communication from management. Worked here 6+ years and still enjoy every day!
cons: I don't consider these cons but some may...you must be flexible and adaptable,  work can be challenging (but rewarding), healthcare in general is not very exciting and can be frustrating to keep up with.

pros: Supportive of career and personal growth, challenging, open communication culture among executives and all employees.
cons: Work can get repetitive and must be able to work well in a fast-paced environment.

pros: Great co-workers! Teamwork is highly valued. Leadership listens to ideas and suggestions even if they aren’t always put in a place. Fast paced. Fun! Good benefits and good work life balance.
cons: Always busy!!!! But makes it so it’s never boring.
